author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text:
My heart goes out to all the Mothers who are struggling as we approach Mother’s Day.  I know it can feel lonely, so know that I’m m here if you ever need someone to talk to mamas🤎
As I approach my child’s 8th birthday, I can tell you that grief ebbs and flows, just keep going 🤎 https://t.co/EUCcOOfFlm

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: So mind your mother fucking business and #KeepYourLawsOffOfMyBody https://t.co/SWWjhXiyuB

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: People have abortions for MANY different reasons. Including, but not limited to: choosing to live, not being able to afford children, not having physical support, mental health, physical health, abuse, rape, miscarriage, and many more reasons. #MyBodyMyChoice

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: When I saw the post 2, now that I’m typing this 7 😂 https://t.co/qm9JpW4NSd

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: I couldn’t help staring at my child’s face, before agreeing to let her take him… Then I watched as the nurse put my my child in the center of the blanket, grab the four corners, and carry my child out like he was a sac of trash. I don’t wish this pain or experience on anyone.

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 3 (6/20) after trying serval medical abortion methods and being induced, I gave birth to my deceased child and held him for 12 HOURS. I finally got up to go to the bathroom and I laid my child down. While I was gone the nurse came to take my child, but my fam made her wait

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Miscarrying & having to get an abortion is one of the main reasons I am pro-choice now. If I had the choice back then I would’ve chose to have my 7 year old right now, but you never know the reasons why people choose abortion. Choosing between your & your baby’s life is hard asf.

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: The drama of Day 2 was messy asf ranging my older siblings showing up and talking shit about the dude who got me pregnant not being there for me to nursing saying I was exaggerating the pain I was in because I wasn’t in labor yet… bd did show up tho, had my fam feeling stupid 🙌🏽

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: If I had not had those options I would’ve had to continue carry my child’s lifeless body and risk my health until my body was ready to release. https://t.co/eMCjBB0DlB

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19) The doctor gave me a form with two options because waiting any longer for the child to pass on its own was no longer an option for my safety. I have to pick between a surgical abortion D&E or a medical abortion. https://t.co/yEGsYhgZIN

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: With a missed miscarriage sometimes the body will finally recognize and release naturally… Unfair that was not the case for me, without knowing how to explain it better, my child was already starting to decay in my body which could’ve literally kill me https://t.co/xgkfkPQzqU

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: You may be thinking I just read all 16 of these tweets and I still can figure out how your miscarriage is related to abortion rights… I had what is called a missed miscarriage. https://t.co/dlalMyZm2W

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: (6/19) I don’t remember too much of what happened next just that I finally felt at ease for 20 minutes before a 2nd ultrasound and a 3rd (for a second opinion), before being told that I miscarried and my body hadn’t recognized that my baby was no longer living

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19) I get to the maternity floor 5 people surrounded me asking how far along I was, the type of pains I was experiencing, and why I came, and gave me a bunch of papers sign without much explanation. Then my mom arrived.

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19) The nurse asked why I didn’t tell the receptionist I was pregnant . Irritated and anxious I yelled at him saying that I did and she told me to have a seat. He said “usually we take women to the maternity floor immediately,” as rushed me to the unit. Scaring me more.

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19) I get to the hospital, I check in and share that the doctor couldn’t find my baby’s heart beat and sent me to emergency. The receptionist was rude and brushed me off. I waited on the lobby for 2 hours before a nurse called my name in panic and asked if I was pregnant

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19) All I remember is crying, because I had no idea wtf that meant I just knew something wasn’t right. I couldn’t even talk to tell my mom I was heading to the hospital. Now my experience at the hospital is why I try to avoid pregnancy at all cost

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 They both returned with concerned looks on their faces, looked at me and the second lady said “I want to try one more thing. We’re struggling to find the heartbeat, usually we can hear it as soon as we touch the belly. We recommend you go to the emergency room immediately.”

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19) The technician returned with another person who introduced themselves and stated that they would be verifying measurements and taking pictures. She started adjusting with knobs again while moving around my stomach. Then both women left as I marveled at pic on screen https://t.co/huFy9hMnJO

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Yooo I still can’t find the ultrasound but my dumb ass found a sex tape I didn’t know I had 🤦🏽‍♀️🤣🤣 I’m embarrassed

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: I’m looking for my ultrasound picture to finish my thread… I can’t find the virtual picture, but I l know the hard copy is over 200 miles away… I’ll finish when find it 😭

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19)  The tech told him that my baby’s body measured at exactly 20 weeks, but his head measured at 23 weeks. I thought do myself “damn, he will have a big ass head like his ‘father’” as I watched her turn several knobs on and off on machines before leaving the room

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day2 (6/19) We get setup in the ultrasound room and start getting measurements. My dad says “You sure you’re only 20 weeks that’s a whole baby.” (🤦🏽‍♀️ men and their ignorance even after having 5 kids) The technicians responded to him https://t.co/3eGWHWmhEA

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19) we make it to the appointment. They share information to talk me out of an abortion that I didn’t want anyway. I listened and more importantly my dad listened. (This is all backstory, who knew my life would turn upside down when I got to the room for the ultrasound)

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 2 (6/19) my father shows up at my door and starts getting all of the necessary paperwork for an abortion. I call this place called Problem Pregnancy, they shared that they did not do abortions, but offered me an appointment for an ultrasound.

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 1 (6/18) The doctor eased my mind a bit, but what we didn’t know then was how wrong she was… After the appointment I told my father via phone call and less than 8 hours later he traveled 1200 miles to “convince” me to get an abortion. #MyBodyMyChoice

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: Day 1 (6/18) - My mom took me to the public health department to get STD testing and confirm my pregnancy. While in the health department I remember seeing signs like this one and thinking “I hope my backaches are normal.” When I saw the doctor I asked and they said it’s normal https://t.co/TeixZOt1FO

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text:
I was trying to hide my pregnancy, so I was going through the pains and unknown ALONE. 
The three days after I told my mom we’re traumatic asf.

author: Papier MaChee 🤑💰
text: I was 5 months pregnant experiencing a lot of back pain and stomach pain, but as a teen I thought it was normal pregnancy pains.
